Legal_Issue: Credibility of evidence in refugee claim
Credibility_Assessment: Inconsistent credibility findings: initial credibility accepted, later dismissed without justification
Evidence_Type: Personal statement (POE), fear of persecution by Albanian mafia and police
Legal_Provision: Sections 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution due to father's political affiliations and refusal to pay protection money
Evaluation_Standard: Credible evidence of persecution or risk of harm
Proceeding_Type: Refugee protection claim and judicial review
Regulation_Cited: Sections 96, 97, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Review_Outcome: Decision overturned and remanded for reconsideration
Evidence_Ignored: Initial finding of credibility in POE statement
Legal_Standard: Requirement to demonstrate well-founded fear of persecution
Application_Factor: Risk from non-state actors (Albanian mafia) and state complicity (police)
Decision_Outcome: Dismissal of refugee and protection claims
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether dismissal was based on credible evidence
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Sections 96 and 97, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Outcome_of_Review: Remanded for re-evaluation by a different tribunal
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credibility assigned despite prior consistent statements
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to provide coherent and consistent decision-making process
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review challenging procedural fairness and credibility analysis
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Sections 96 and 97
Procedural_Issue: Inadequate reasoning leading to unfair process
Omission_Type: Failure to reconcile conflicting credibility findings
